definition: to support/to prop up/to push or move with a pole/to maintain/to open or unfurl/to fill to bursting point/brace/stay/support
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control

sentences.english: If there's a single word you should live your life by- it should be this: Love.
sentences.chinese: 若是让一个词成为你的生活撑持的话，那它应当是爱。

sentences.english: Look for references to support the new beliefs you want to cultivate.
sentences.chinese: 查找相关的原料来撑持你想培育的新观念。

sentences.english: We solicit a continuance of your confidence and support.
sentences.chinese: 恳请贵方持续赐与信赖，大年夜力撑持。

sentences.english: Footprints are one of the few pieces of hard evidence supporting the existence of Yeti.
sentences.chinese: 脚印是目前撑持野人存在说的为数不多的实证之一。

sentences.english: Many of his friends backed his plan.
sentences.chinese: 他的良多伴侣撑持他的方案。

sentences.english: I hope we can more support public transport.
sentences.chinese: 自己但愿自己们可以愈加撑持大众交通东西。

sentences.english: Bilateral and multilateral funding and financial initiatives must be accelerated.
sentences.chinese: 应该加快双边和多边资助和财政主动撑持。

definition: to strive/to make an effort/to exert oneself
to restore (deposed monarch, rule, system of laws, ecological system etc)/restoration
family livelihood/a household's economic situation/family property
to depend ultimately on (Tw)/absolutely reliant on
to rely on sb for support
